parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A child, descendent, inhabitant. From the base of timoria; a child.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Plural

str2: Probably from the same as pale; anew, i.e. back, once more, or furthermore or on the other hand.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To be in travail, suffer birth-pangs. From odin; to experience the pains of parturition.
As far as, until, even to.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To form, fashion, shape, mold. From the same as morphe; to fashion.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
